abstract.text: An assignable document is an augmented PDF that allows teachers to mark up
the PDF with the intention of students taking the assessment.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The document has several parts, which includes the ability to modify the PDF,
annotate the PDF, and define question regions in the PDF.
To add a question to this assignable, you can use
which will take care of associating a box to a page and adding a question connected
to that box to the document.
This document is fully mergeable, which means that any copies of this document
that are independently mutated can be merged into a determinisitic resulting
document. You can merge copies of this document into this one using
You can also merge individual parts of copies of this
For example, if deviceA has documentA and
deviceB has documentB, which is a copy of documentA. When a user changes a
question in documentB on deviceB, deviceB can export that part’s data
and send it to deviceA to be merged back into documentA.
You can create as many of these objects as you have memory for.

abstract.text: A framework that contain wrappers to a PDF to allow creation
of an assessment and student work on that assessment.
Documents conforming to this protocol can be assigned to a user.
An assignable document is an augmented PDF that allows teachers to mark up
the PDF with the intention of students taking the assessment.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.
The configuration for an assessment which contains options
for display of marks and their point values.
The glyph to use that represents a correct mark.
The type for elements of this document. An element is a component
of the document such as a page or question.
Errors for this document type.
A type representing the stable identity of this document.
An enumeration containing the identities of parts managed by this view.
A question in the assignable document.
A box on a page for a question.
Creates a new question and appends it to the document.
The set of identities of users that created or modified this assignable.

Access the question that the identifier denotes, if any.
Access the page that the identifier denotes, if any.
An assigned work document is a document that contains taker and
scorer markup specific to a taker. It also contains a copy of the assignable
document upon which it is based.
Documents conforming to this protocol can merge several
copies of the document into a single document.
Objects conforming to this protocol allow
merging in other replicas of themselves or
merging in individual parts of themselves.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
